candidates.title: hyper updated to 0.11
candidates.body: `jsonrpc-http-server` can be released to crates.io :)

candidates.title: IPC pub-sub (#152)
candidates.body:
* Move session to server-utils.

* sessions support for IPC

candidates.title: IPC pub-sub
candidates.body:
Closes #50 
Closes #18 (Was done previously by @NikVolf)

candidates.title: Trailing parameters for subscriptions.
candidates.body: I thought it won't be required, but apparently we need this to support geth-compatible PubSub in Parity.

candidates.title: Supporting Host/Origin wildcards. (#136)
candidates.body:
* Supporting Host/Origin wildcards.

* Removing println!

candidates.title: Updating basic macros example.
candidates.body: Related: #127

candidates.title: WS pubsub example.
candidates.body:
- Exposing `futures::sync::mpsc::Sender` in `RequestContext`
- Apparently `ws::Sender` doesn't track if the connection is still active so I've added manual tracking and exposed it in `RequestContext`.
- Updates all examples to avoid glob imports (only `jsonrpc_core` is imported with a wildcard)

Closes: #120

candidates.title: Update/refactor to latest tokio_io (#122), backport
candidates.body:
* failing tests for tcp and ipc

* encoder/decoder

* fix remaining

* also tcp

* fix warnings

* review fixes

* fix warnings

candidates.title: Update/refactor to latest tokio_io
candidates.body: Also added some tests which had been failing before refactoring, but now ok, since tokio guys resolved issues with handles recycling.

candidates.title: kirushik tests and fixes using async connect for stable branch
Support multiple hyper threads.
candidates.body:
Closes #102 

Benchmarks:
- 1 thread: 21,374 req/s
- 4 threads 75,751 req/s

candidates.title: Use latest hyper (master)
candidates.body:
Implements `jsonrpc-http-sever` using future-based `master` branch of `hyper`.
Related #91 

Also fixes couple of TODOs (unecessary Boxing in minihttp and `io::Error`s propagation)

Performance stats (example `server`, compiled in `--release`)
1. Old http: 2.157 req/s
2. New http: 23.456 req/s
3. Mini http (threads=1): 33.822 req/s

candidates.title: Parity-related improvements
candidates.body:
- Unify http and minihttp APIs
- Add `control` to HttpMiddleware

candidates.title: Bump version
candidates.body: annoying you have to make pr for this^^

candidates.title: Don't process invalid CORS requests
candidates.body:
Closes #62 

Also returns correct headers for OPTIONS requests.

candidates.title: Use generalized transport for IPC (WIP)
candidates.body: Sorry haven't seen that you squashed previous pr, so it contains commits from former prs

candidates.title: Pre processing CORS and Host headers
candidates.body:
Closes #61 

+ Version bump for all crates.

candidates.title: Publish-Subscribe macros support
candidates.body: Closes: #51

candidates.title: Shared server utils
candidates.body:
Contains event loop spawning/sharing, hosts validation and cors-headers.
Closes #55 
Closes #26 

Will need some additional work when #54 is merged.

candidates.title: WebSockets server
candidates.body: Closes #49

candidates.title: Pub/Sub crate
candidates.body:
Initial implementation of publish subscribe. Example uses `jsonrpc-tcp-server`.

Outstanding issues:
- [ ] Implementation for IPC #50 
- [ ] Macros support #51 
- [ ] Websockets Server #49 

It will be implemented as separate PRs, will also create corresponding issues.

Closes #53

candidates.title: HTTP implementation using tokio-minihttp
candidates.body: Closes #11

candidates.title: Aligning all versions
candidates.body:
All versions aligned to `6.0.0`

Everything except `jsonrpc-http-server` can be released to `crates.io`, I also drafted a release notes.

candidates.title: Update serde dependency to 0.9.0
candidates.body: This lets jsonrpc build on stable (1.15) without needing serde_codegen

candidates.title: Middleware support for core
candidates.body: and re-export of futures
